bibl.title: Interrogatory of Lewis F Linn, Eloy Le Compte, and John Scott=
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the original.

keywords.term: Eloy Le Compte, John Le Compte, S. Le Compte, Lewis F. Linn, Mary, John Scott
Illinois, Missouri, Wisconsin, St. Genevieve, Kaskaskia, Prairie Du Rocher

div1.p: State of Missouri County of St Genevieve
Paul Jones man of color vs G W Jones

Trespass on premises in the district county for the county of Grant Territory of Wisconsin We the undersigned two of commissiners in the annexed commission named & to us directed by the Honorable the District court for the county of in the Territory of Wisconsin did on the 19th day of September AD 1840 cause to come before us as the court house in the town of the St Genevieve and State of Missouri Lewis F Linn John Scott and Eloy Le Compte three of the persons in the caption of said several interrogatives named being unable to procure the attendance of the others as witnesses to answer said interrogatories or the part of the defendant in the above named suit and they bring duly sworn upon this corporal oaths by us examined diligantly & faithfully upon said interrogatives in the order in which they propounded and the answer of each of them thereto annexed in the order in which the same was given
Conrad L. Ziegler La. Grafton
of these interrogatives named or either of them and how long have you known them respectively

2nd Interrogatory- Are you acquainted with the hand writing of S. La Compte John H Le Compte and Eloy Le Compte the vendors whose names are signed to the annexed Bill of sale marked A. if so pleae state;
3 interrogatory- Were you present when the said Bill of Sale or instrument in writing was executed and delivered to George W. Jones the defendant and did you sign the same as subscribing witnesses

4thinterrogatory- Is the signature of Lewis F Linn attached to the said instrument of writing as a subscribing witness to the same your own signature, if so state when you signed the same and at whose request?

5th interrogatory Are you or either of you acquainted with the coloured man named Paul sold and transferred in the said bill of sale and do you or either of you know was his mother whether she was or is a slave so called under the right of property secured to the ancient inhabitants of the vilage of Kaskaskia and Prairie Du Rocher then north western territory now Illinois by the orderance of congress of the thirtennth day of July AD 1787 for the governemntof the Territory of the United States north west of the Ohio river if so pleae state all you know in relation to as fully as if particularly interrogated thereto?-
6thinterrgatory Do you know where and

mentioned in the said bill of sale and the plantiff in this suit was born and whether before the sale to the defendant George W Jones as aforesaid he was bound to vendor service to this former owner for life as a slave so called according to the ancient usages and customs governing French and Canadian inhabitants of said vilages

7 interrogatory Do you know if the sale of the said colored man called Paul mentioned in the said bill of sale to the defendant was with or against the wish & request of the said Paul and did or not the said Paul go willingly into the service of the said defendant

8th interrogatory Do you known of any other matter or thing further that may tend to the benefit and advantages of the defendant in this cause in the elucidation of this subject if so please state fully & particularly

When Lewis F Linn who being first duly sworn answers to said interrogatories as follows to the first he answers & says that he knowns both the parties plaintiff and defendant that he has known the plantiff & defendant that he has known the plaintiff about seventeen years and the defendant since he was a small boy

And to the second interrogatory he answers & says that he is acquainted with the handwriting of S Le Compte John H Le Compte & Eloy Lecompte that the signatures of said persons to the bill of sale marked A is in the proper hand writing of said persons that his knowledge of this handwriting is derived from the part of having seen them often write & also from having seen them sign & acknowledge

Said Bill of sale and to the third interrogatory he answers & says that he was present when said instrument of writing was executed & delievered to George W Jones and that he signed the same as a subscribing witness

And for answers to the fourth interrogatory he answers & says that the signatures of Lewis F Linn to said instrument is his proper handwriting & signature and that he subscribed the same on the day and year it porports to be executed and at the request of the parties thereto

And for answer to the 5thinterrogatory he answers and says that he has been acquainted with Paul who was transferred by said bill of sale about Seventeen years. that he (Paul) was brot to Missouri from Illinois by the vendor as a slave that he was by said bill of sale sold to George . W. Hones as a slave and that Paul acknowledged to him that he was a slave and that he was born in the family of LE Compte in Illinois & Prairie Du Rocher and that thatfrom part of his own knowledge he believes that said Paul was born in Illinois and that he always understood that Paul was what was called a French slave. held under the ordinance of the 13th July AD 1787 as to the mother of Paul he say he knows nothing

And for the answer to the sixth interrogatory he says that of his own knowledge he does not know when said Paul was born but has always understood from the family of Le compte & from others that he was born in Prairie Du Rocher Illinois as a French slave And for answers to the the seventh interrogatory he answers & says that the sale of Paul by the vendor in the Bill of sale named to George. W. Jones was made at the request and desire of Paul and that Paul was very anxious that Jones

And for the answer to the 3d interrogatory he answers & says that the mother of said Paul was well known to him that she was a Slave in Illinois prior to the year 1787 that she was purchased of one Lacond resident of Illinois either a Canadian by birth or of Canadian parents that she resided until within a few years in the village of Prairie Du Rocher Illinois that she was sometimes called so mulle alias Caiwnin that her right name is Mary that he always understood from the family and others that she was what was called a French slave for life she purchased her freedom of S. Le. Compte between the years 1820 and 1824 for the sum of two hundred dollars as near as he can remember
And for answer to the 4th interrogatory he says that Paul was born in the Village of Prairie Du Rocher Illinois about the year 1805

And for answer to the 5th interrogatory he says that Paul was held as a slave to service for life in Illinois under the laws & usages of the late North Western Territory in favor of the ancient French & Canadian inhabitants of the villages of Kashkakia Prairie Du Rocher & Chahokia & that said Paul was born the property of the father of deponent who always resided in Prairie Du Rocher Illinois and that he never was Canadian other than a slave for life

And for answer to the 6th interrogatory he says that from the information received from the family and from others who were old enough to known he always understood & believes that the mother of Paul was a slave in Prairie Du Rocher Illinois prior to the 13 July 1787 held & owned and such by one of the Canadian inhabitants mentioned in the 5th interrogatory And for answer to the 7th interrogatory he replies that from information derived from the family that the mother of Paul was held by the above named Lacond as a slave for life prior to 13th July 1787
And for answer to the 8th interrogatory he answers & that he is in no wise directly or indirectly interested in the event of the said between Plantiff & defendant above named
And for answer to the 9th interrogatory he answers & says that he does not now remeber anything further that would tend to illucidate the mother in controversy Eloy Le Compte

We the undersigned two of the commissioners to whom the annexed commission was directed do herby certify that Lewis F Linn John Scott & Eloy Le Compte three if the witnesses in the caption of the interrogatories named on the 9th day of september AD 1840 of the court house in the town of St Genevieve and State of Missouri appeared before us to answer said interrogatories which were then & there propounded to them in the order in which the same are herein set forth and were by us first sworn on the Holy of almighty god to make true & full answers to interrogatories and the answers herein given & set forth are the answers given by said witnesses respectively and the signatures of said witnesses to said depostiion in the proper hand writing of said witnesses who subscribed the same in our presence on the day and year aforesaid at the place aforesaid and that said deponents were sworn to the court of said depositions after the same were reduced to writing & subscribed by them of the time & place aforesaid In witness whereof we have herewith set on hands this 9th day of september 1840 St genevieve State of Missouri
Conrad L. Ziegler La. Grafton
